snippet: The first-of-its-kind program will draw on the Army’s storied First Infantry Division, based in Kansas, to conduct more than 100 missions in Africa over the next year.
abstract: First-of-its-kind Pentagon program will send troops from the army’s storied First Infantry Division, based in Kansas, to conduct more than 100 missions in Africa over next year; aim of program is to train and advise indigenous forces on how to tackle emerging terrorist threats and other security risks so that American forces do not have to.

byline.contributor: Thom Shanker contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The first-of-its-kind program will draw on the Army’s storied First Infantry Division, based in Kansas, to conduct more than 100 missions in Africa over the next year.
